message: Hi Bob, I'm selling this unique product that I believe will be of great value to you.  I'm offering it to you at a price of $20000.  This is a very competitive price considering its potential. What do you think?
Thank you for the offer, Alice. I appreciate your time and consideration. I am interested in purchasing the product, but I can only afford to pay up to $15000. I hope we can come to an agreement.

Bob, I understand your budget constraints. While I value this product at significantly more than $15000, I'm willing to make a concession. I'm willing to sell it to you for $18000. This represents a significant discount from my initial offer. I believe this price reflects a fair compromise.
I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, Alice. I would like to propose a price of $16500 for the product. I hope this aligns better with your valuation and allows us to reach an agreement.

Bob, I see your offer is moving in the right direction. However, I am still firm on a price closer to my initial assessment. I'm willing to come down to $17500. This would still be a good deal for you, and it's a fair compromise considering the value of the product. Let's work towards a mutually beneficial agreement.

Thank you for adjusting your offer, Alice. I appreciate your flexibility. I would like to counter with a price of $17000 for the product. I hope this proposal will lead to a satisfactory agreement for both of us.
